results.title: Gel
results.creator_credit: Ralph Henderson, Eric White and Films Sagittaire
results.brief_description: Produced for the Davis Gelatine company, the film uses a domestic science student to outline some of the properties and uses of gelatine. Various examples of modern gelatine cookery are also shown.

results.title: The Minemaker
results.creator_credit: Rod Kinnear, Conzinc Riotinto Australia and Rod Kinnear Productions
results.brief_description: This film describes the varied activities of CRA and its associates and subsidiary companies, including exploration, mining at Broken Hill, the Hammersley Iron project, financing and computer work, Comalco’s aluminium industry, Blair Athol coal, and copper mining on Bougainville.

results.title: Southeast Asia: a culture history
results.creator_credit: Arthur Niehoff and Sigma Educational Films
results.brief_description: Explains the cultures of Vietnam, Laos, Cambodia and Thailand as a blend of indigenous tribal traditions and the high culture of Hindu-Buddhist India. Discusses how former centres of empire stand as testimony to the endurance of Buddhist and Brahman idea systems in Southeast Asia. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Cyclone = Ciclon
results.creator_credit: Santiago Alvarez and Instituto Cubano del Arte e Industrias Cinematográficos (ICAIC)
results.brief_description: A non-narrated film showing the havoc caused by the cyclone which hit the western provinces of Cuba in October, 1963. Reveals the tragic consequences for the poor peasants and also shows the care taken of the injured and the homeless.

results.title: Fingers of gold
results.creator_credit: Banana Growers Federation and Kingcroft Productions
results.brief_description: Illustrates banana production and distribution in New South Wales. Provides information on such aspects as irrigation, protection from the cold, pests and fungus, harvesting, packing and controlled ripening.

results.title: The City of Melbourne
results.brief_description: Roger Climpson narrates this concise and interesting film on Melbourne. A brief history is outlined at the beginning noting some of the key figures who moved Melbourne from a settlement to a city, including John Batman and John Fawker. An incredible amount of material is fitted into the film’s short duration, including the outer central business locations like Albert Park, Flemington, St Kilda and Northland Shopping Centre, Preston. The newer multi-story buildings in the city are attractively shot. Opening shot of the infamous (now demolished) Gas and Fuel Corporation of Victoria building in its early stages of construction. Also includes footage of the Robin Boyd Southgate fountain sculpture in Snowden Gardens.

results.title: Fit For the Future
results.creator_credit: Physical Education Branch, Visual Education Centre
results.brief_description: Shows the range of physical education activities provided in Victorian primary schools. Running, jumping, folk dancing, tumbling, team games and swimming are all encouraged so as to develop physical potential.

results.title: Melbourne: festival city
results.creator_credit: Gordon C. Lloyd, Tourist Development Authority of Victoria and Cinesound
results.brief_description: Melbourne’s Moomba festival - the city comes alive with processions, regattas, the Herald open air art show, music under the stars at the Myer Music Bowl, and the crowning of the Moomba Queen. The film also shows some of the Melbourne landscape and the background of daily life; Melbourne’s economic expansion; the Melbourne Cup, the race for which the nation stands still; Australian Rules Football, drawing crowds of over 50,000; fine golf courses; hunting; night life. It closes with a coverage of the Moomba procession, with all its varied floats, including the Bunyip and the Chinese dragon.

results.title: Boys in the age of machines
results.creator_credit: Giorgio Mangiamele, Ronald Mason and Academy Film Productions
results.brief_description: Presents the many opportunities available today in the field of engineering. Shows a typical machine-shop where a young apprentice follows the production of a pattern from the drawing board design to the casting being finished in the dressing shop. Outlines various diploma and degree courses; employment opportunities based on educational qualifications; preliminary subjects required in basic education.
